data.enText: the way that you think and feel about sb/sth; the way that you behave towards sb/sth that shows how you think and feel

data.chText: 公众对婚姻的看法的转变
data.enText: changes in public attitudes to marriage
the government's attitude towards single parents

data.chText: 对某人（或事物）持好的 / 坏的 / 肯定的 / 否定的态度
data.enText: to have a good/bad/positive/negative attitude towards sb/sth
Youth is simply an attitude of mind .

data.chText: 你若想通过考试就最好改变你的态度！
data.enText: If you want to pass your exams you'd better change your attitude!

data.chText: 你对这个问题的看法相当自私，对不对？
data.enText: You're taking a pretty selfish attitude over this, aren't you?

data.chText: 许多驾车者有严重的态度问题。
data.enText: A lot of drivers have a serious attitude problem (= they do not behave in a way that is acceptable to other people) .
confident, sometimes aggressive behaviour that shows you do not care about other people's opinions and that you want to do things in an individual way

data.chText: 一味只顾自我陶醉的乐队
年轻人，你最好改掉那种态度，学学好。
data.enText: You'd better get rid of that attitude and shape up, young man.

data.chText: 她双手合拢成祈祷姿势。
data.enText: Her hands were folded in an attitude of prayer.
to hold your body in a particular way to create a particular impression

ex.chText: 该党对于教育改革持什么态度？
ex.enText: What is the party's position on education reform?

ex.chText: 董事会认为拓展海外市场的时机已经成熟。
ex.enText: The board took the position that the time was ripe for expanding the overseas market.

synonyms.bx: 尤指政府、政党、当权者对某一事件、问题等的意见。

ex.chText: 他有着积极的生活态度。
ex.enText: He has a positive attitude towards life.

ex.chText: 我真的无法理解他对歌手的看法。
ex.enText: I really can't understand his attitude towards singers.

synonyms.bx: 指对某人或某事物的一般看法。

ex.chText: 他被指责在环境问题上没有立场。
ex.enText: He was accused of not taking a stand on environmental issues.

ex.chText: 共和党在这件事情上所持的保守立场颇受关注。
ex.enText: The Republicans' conservative stand on this matter has attracted much attention.

synonyms.bx: 指公开表明的坚定看法。

data.enText: to hold your body in a particular way to create a particular impression

tr: a theatrical pose created for effect
example: the actor struck just the right attitude

tr: the arrangement of the body and its limbs
example: he assumed an attitude of surrender

tr: a complex mental state involving beliefs and feelings and values and dispositions to act in certain ways
example: he had the attitude that work was fun

tr: position of aircraft or spacecraft relative to a frame of reference (the horizon or direction of motion)

value.def: Your attitude to something is the way that you think and feel about it, especially when this shows in the way you behave.

example.ex: ...the general change in attitude towards handicapped people...
example.tran: 对残疾人态度的整体转变

example.ex: Being unemployed produces negative attitudes to work...
example.tran: 失业会产生对工作的消极态度。

example.ex: I don't think it's fair to accuse me of having an attitude problem.
example.tran: 我觉得指责我有态度问题有失公允。

gramarinfo.label: usu with supp, oft N <l>to/towards</l> n

value.tran: （尤指从行为中表现出来的）态度，看法

value.def: If you refer to someone as a person with attitude, you mean that they have a striking and individual style of behaviour, especially a forceful or aggressive one.

example.ex: Patti Smith and Janis Joplin did it all years ago and they were women with attitude and talent.
example.tran: 帕蒂·史密斯和詹妮斯·乔普林多年前就这样做过，她们当时是两位个性鲜明的才女。

value.tran: 个人风格;（尤指）咄咄逼人的作派

value.def: Your attitude of mind is your general way of thinking and feeling.

example.ex: Writing calls for a critical attitude of mind that he did not possess.
example.tran: 写作需要有批判性思维，而这正是他所不具备的。
